text: Ewington is an unincorporated community in Gallia County, in the U.S. state of Ohio. ==History== Ewington was platted in 1852 by George Ewing, and named for his father William "Swago Bill" Ewing. A post office called Ewington was established in 1850, and remained in operation until 1984. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Gallia County, Ohio Category:Unincorporated communities in Ohio
title: Ewington, Ohio
